meanings.definition: The action of habituating or the state of being habituated.
meanings.sent1: Her habituation to early morning walks made them a natural part of her routine.
meanings.sent2: The habituation of the new puppy to its surroundings took some time.
meanings.sent3: The habituation of the cat to wearing a tiny hat was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: His habituation to the chaos of the city was like learning to dance in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The habituation of the plant to direct sunlight resulted in vibrant growth.

meanings.definition: The diminishing of a physiological or emotional response to a frequently repeated stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The habituation to the loud noise made it barely noticeable after a while.
meanings.sent2: The habituation to spicy food made her enjoy it more with each meal.
meanings.sent3: The habituation to the alarm clock ringing was so complete, he slept through it every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her habituation to the cold water was like becoming numb to the world.
meanings.sent5: The habituation to the smell of fresh bread made her crave it every morning.
